message.entry: The Encoding argument is ignored when it is not generating code and the message specifies an encoding. The specified encoding will be used to write the image to the message.
Expected a data length of {0,number,integer} elements (based on image size of {1,number,integer}x{2,number,integer} and {3,number,integer} channels), but instead found {4,number,integer} elements.
Unable to decompress the image data. The image message is either corrupted or, it is not compressed in PNG or JPG format.
Unable to proceed with reading of the compressed image as the image format is not defined. Modify the "format" property of the message object to specify the correct image encoding.
Unable to find a semicolon in format {0}. Modify the 'format' property of the message object appropriately.
The {0} encoding expects an input image with {1} channels, but found only {2}. Modify the input image or specify a different encoding.
No encoding was specified for the input image. MATLAB will assume the image is a 3-channel RGB image (rgb8 encoding).
Converting a Bayer-encoded image to a truecolor image requires an Image Processing Toolbox license.
Expected the input image for {0} encoding to be of type {1}, but instead found {2}. Modify the input image or encoding.
Compressed image format {0} not supported for reading.
Invalid ROS image message. The input argument must be a sensor_msgs/Image or a sensor_msgs/CompressedImage message.
Unable to convert the message to image. Ensure that the data source path is correct and the message is a valid sensor_msgs/Image message.
